intro: Chaerophyllum villarsii var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its smooth, hairless stems and leaves distinguish it from other varieties within the species.
